title: Plant Manager: Pairs of Hypotheses
question_text:
A plant manager wants to see if there are different proportions of defective items among the four machines at her automotive plant.
She randomly selects $100$ automobile parts from each of the four machines, as shown in the table below:
MachineABCD
Number of Defective Parts58425545


What are the best pair of hypotheses the plant manager could state?

choices.text:
H
0
:
There is no association between machine type and defectiveness H
a
:
There is an association between machine type and defectiveness

There is no association between machine type and defectiveness

H
0

Each of the machines is homogenous in their effectiveness to construct non-defective parts H

:
Each of the machines is not homogenous in their effectiveness to construct non-defective parts
